paper.title: Intrusion detection. Applying machine learning to Solaris audit data

author.org: Dept. of Electr. Eng. & Comput. Sci., Tulane Univ., New Orleans, LA, USA#TAB#

paper.abstract: An intrusion detection system (IDS) seeks to identify unauthorized access to computer systemsu0027 resources and data. The most common analysis tool that these modern systems apply is the operating system audit trail that provides a fingerprint of system events over time. In this research, the Basic Security Module auditing tool of Sunu0027s Solaris operating environment was used in both an anomaly and misuse detection approach. The anomaly detector consisted of the statistical likelihood analysis of system calls, while the misuse detector was built with a neural network trained on groupings of system calls. This research demonstrates the potential benefits of combining both aspects of detection in future IDSs to decrease false positive and false negative errors.
